params.name: options
params.doc: Options for sorting, filtering, paging, and specifying return fields.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of categories, given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting.
description:
Query Categories runs with these defaults, which you can override:

- `paging.limit` is `10`
- `paging.offset` is `0`

For field support for filters and sorting,
see [Categories: Supported Filters and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/api-reference/wix-forum/wix-forum/filter-and-sort#category-api-supported-filters-and-sorting).

To learn about working with _Query_ endpoints, see
[API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language),
[Sorting and Paging](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/sorting-and-paging),
and [Field Projection](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/field-projection).

examples.title: queryCategories example for dashboard page code
queryCategories example for exporting from backend code

docs.summary: Subscribes a contact to a specific forum category.
description:
By default a contact isn't subscribed to any forum categories.

By subscribing a contact to a category, the contact receives notifications for that category.

If `contactId` is not provided, it is implicitly resolved from the caller's context.

examples.title: subscribeContactToCategory example for dashboard page code
subscribeContactToCategory example for exporting from backend code

docs.summary: Unsubscribes a contact from a specific forum category.
description:
By default a contact isn't subscribed to any forum categories.

By unsubscribing a contact from a category, the contact wonâ€™t receive notifications for that category.

If `contactId` is not provided, it is implicitly resolved from the caller's context.

unsubscribeContactFromCategory example for exporting from backend code

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc:
Records can be sorted by:
rank
postCount
postViewCount

members.name: order
members.doc: Records can be sorted in ascending (default) or descending order.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date category was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Category ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date category was updated.

members.name: additionalCommentReactions
members.doc: Defines what additional reactions may be applied on the comment under the posts created in this category.

members.name: additionalPostReactions
members.doc: Defines what additional reactions may be applied on the posts created in this category.

members.name: categoryAccess
members.doc: Whether all site visitors and members (`PUBLIC`), all members (`MEMBERS_ONLY`), or only specific members and groups of members with roles, badges or paid subscriptions (`PRIVATE`) can access posts in category.

members.name: commentInteraction
members.doc: Defines what interactions may be applied on the comment under the posts created in this category.

members.name: description
members.doc: Category description.

members.name: groups
members.doc: IDs of groups which can access category if `categoryAccess` is `'PRIVATE'`.

members.name: headerImage
members.doc: Category header image.

members.name: headerTitle
members.doc: Category header title.

members.name: headerType
members.doc: Category header type.

members.name: mainCommentReaction
members.doc:
Defines which icon will be used for the main reaction on the comment under the posts created in this category.

Default `type`: `"LIKE"`.

members.name: mainPostReaction
members.doc:
Defines which icon will be used for main reaction on the posts created in this category.

Default `type`: `"LIKE"`.

members.name: name
members.doc: Category name.

members.name: noMemberPosting
members.doc: Whether only admins and moderators can write posts in category.

members.name: parentId
members.doc: Category parent ID.

members.name: postCount
members.doc: Total number of posts in category.

members.name: postInteraction
members.doc: Defines what interactions may be applied on the posts created in this category, like or multiple reactions.

members.name: postViewCount
members.doc: Total number of post views in category.

members.name: rank
members.doc: The position of the category in the display order.

members.name: slug
members.doc: Category slug.

members.name: url
members.doc: Category URL.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: ID of the retrieved category.

members.name: color

members.name: opacity
members.doc: Opacity (from 0 to 1)

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: ID of category.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: settings
members.doc: SEO general settings.

members.name: tags
members.doc: SEO tag information.

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: keywords
members.doc: User-selected keyword terms for a specific page.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc:
Whether the Auto Redirect feature, which creates `301 redirects` on a slug change, is enabled.

Default: `false` (Auto Redirect is enabled.)

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: categoryId
members.doc: Category ID.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: disabled
members.doc: Whether the tag is disabled.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: props
members.doc:
A `{'key':'value'}` pair object where each SEO tag property (`'name'`, `'content'`, `'rel'`, `'href'`) contains a value.
For example: `{'name': 'description', 'content': 'the description itself'}`.

members.name: type
members.doc:
SEO tag type.

Supported values: `title`, `meta`, `script`, `link`.
